lead_paragraph: A growing movement in the borough seeks to equip young people with the knowledge and the skills to write code so that they can navigate an increasingly digital world.

headline.print_headline: Teaching Bronx Students the Language of Computers
headline.main: Teaching Bronx Students the Language of Computers

snippet: A growing movement in the borough seeks to equip young people with the knowledge and the skills to write code so that they can navigate an increasingly digital world.
abstract: Campaign to encourage teaching of computer coding in Bronx schools by nonprofit Code/Interactive is part of broader push in New York City to make students more fluent in technology; Mayor Bill de Blasio has announced $81 million education initiative that will require computer science courses be offered in all city public schools by 2025, but Bronx effort is particularly necessary given way borough has lagged behind others in attracting technology jobs.
